runs.comm: pitched up and outside off, drags Sibanda into a flashy drive outside off and beats him on the outside edge. Not much feet movement from Sibanda. He simply threw his bat at it
Sibanda succeeds now. Pitched further up and outside off, he hits it on the up and crunches a drive over the covers to get off the mark with a four
tight line on off, on a good length, pressed to the covers
banged in on a shortish length and hurries onto the batsman with some inward movement. He does not connect with the pull, wearing it on the waistline
on a length and outside off, Sibanda goes for an uppish drive and slices it in the air to the right of Malik at cover-point. He could just finger-tip it away after leaping up
good length on off, Masakadza invests in a dab-and-run single in front of point. Sibanda reciprocated well
good length and nibbling away outside off, ignored
back of a length and swinging away outside off, past the groping bat. Masakadza was crease-bound here
good length and attacking off, blocked back to the bowler
fractionally short on off, he camps back and picks it up over midwicket. Not middled, though. He earns a couple
he steps out and yorks himself but manages to squirt it square on the leg side for a couple of runs
width on offer outside off, Masakadza wants to kitchen-sink it away. He slashes hard and gets a thick outside edge that flies to deep third man
fired full on off, Masakadza drills a drive past the bowler, it just whistles away to the long-off boundary
encore! Fuller and on off, he stands tall and smashes it up and over the bowler's head for another authoritative strike
he did not larrup this, just finesse. Shortish and outside off, he opens the face of his bat and glides it through vacant slip cordon. Three fours on the bounce for Masakadza
Bhatti retorts with a lifter, he arches his back and lets it fly through to the keeper
banged in short, not much sting on it. He rocks back and across as he  controls a pull to deep backward square leg
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, punched crisply to the covers
Afridi has hurt his left hand, has he split his webbing? Down the track and powered to mid-off. Afridi has gone off the field... Not good news for the hosts
on a length and outside off, Masakadza launches it over the bowler's head, bisecting mid-on and mid-off for a flat blow
back of a length on off, blocked back to Sami
on a length and on the stumps, driven straight to mid-on
slower ball dupes the batsman. He makes room, is early into the slash and gets beaten
hurled full on off, driven to mid-on. Malik (I guess) at mid-off moves to his left and stops the ball
full on off, forced back to the bowler
welcome to international cricket says Hami Masakadza. He nips down the track and slaps it over the bowler's head
slid through on middle and leg, swept straight to short fine leg
darted short and wide outside off as he steps down the track and flat-bats it to the covers. The throw is to the keeper and is high and off-radar, giving them a single
arm-ball snakes in with the angle, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
dug in shortish and on middle, quelled in front of the covers
good length on off, he stands tall and punchily drives it back to the bowler, who intercepts with his left hand and deflects it to mid-on
bumpy short ball, slower in pace as well. He aims for a pull before belatedly bailing out. It soars to the keeper. The square-leg umpire calls it a wide
length ball on middle, helped up and over midwicket with a neat pick-up shot
hammered... Back of a length and outside off, Sibanda hits through the line and punches it, beating mid-off to his right
veering down leg, he attempted a slower one. Wide called
full and straight, whirl of the wrists as he flicks it behind square. Sibanda wanted two, Masakadza wasn't interested
slips a highish full toss down leg. He attempted another slower ball and it slipped out of his hand. The batsman ducks under it. No ball
dug in shortish, he controls a pull to deep square leg after rolling his wrists on it. 50 up for Zimbabwe
darted flat, full toss on the pads, he does not connect with a flick. Squirts it in front of square leg off the pads
looped up on off, pushed back to the bowler
length and outside off, he eases a drive down to long-off, trots off to the other end
quicker on off, down the track and hacked to long-on off the inner part of the bat
slower through the air and full on off, laced to the covers
clears long-on! Length around off, he takes the aerial route and chips it over the fielder. Zimbabwe continue to motor along smoothly
tucked away past midwicket for a couple
dropped short and outside off, he goes on the back foot and short-arm pulls to long-on
legbreak outside off, spins away with extra bounce. He has a crack at it and slices it in the gap between the two fielders behind point
looped up and spinning away outside off, he pushes forward and misses. The keeper had whipped the bails off, but he had held his balance
pressed in front of the covers for a speedy single
darted flat on the stumps, forced down to long-on
flat and full on off, pushed to long-off
angled on middle and leg, he nudges a single past midwicket

holes out to long-on! Pakistan break the opening stand. Fuller and on middle and leg, Sibanda goes for a lofted strike and mishits it to Anwar Ali. He intended to go a lot squarer but did not get hold of it. Shehzad hugs Malik.
flighted on middle, driven to the right of the bowler, towards long-off
length ball on off, whisked to the leg side
low full toss on middle, bunted down to long-on

collision at cow-corner. Both Malik and Sami are down. Malik (deep midwicket) bumped his head into the knee of Sami (long-on), who had slipped while diving near the boundary. Malik sips some drinks and looks okay. Whipped away by Sibanda for three. Malik and Sami hug it out. All okay..
good length, legbreak, pushed back to the bowler
down the track and driven to long-off
slid through outside off and turning away, chopped off the back foot past the covers
pitched up and outside off, Williams runs down the track, meets the pitch of this ball and lofts it in the air, beating long-off to his left
length on middle, he gallops down the track again, this time hoicking it up and over midwicket
full on the stumps, pushed back to Malik
flat on middle, jammed back to the bowler again
picked away off the pads and clipped to the right of midwicket
pitched up on middle, Williams gives the charge and check-lofts it, chipping it in front of long-on
low full toss on middle, clubbed away to deep midwicket
pitched up on off, driven crisply to long-off
slower lifter, which is pulled away behind square on the leg side. They hare across for the second.
back of a length and outside off, slapped fiercely past the covers, beats sweeper's dive near the boundary
back of a length and outside off, stops on the batsman as Anwar pulls pace off it. Pushed to the covers
full and straight, nicely tucked away past midwicket. The fielder in the deep runs to his left, dives and hauls the ball in, keeping it to three
bouncer, second of the over. He ducks under it. No ball called
short and on middle, pulled away to deep midwicket
short and width on offer outside off, cut away to deep third man off the back foot
low full toss on middle, almost chipped back to the bowler. It just died in front of Malik
another full toss, this one is on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket
full on middle, Williams flits down the track and powers it to long-off
whipped to the left of midwicket to long-on as this was full and straight
Shehzad dives to his right at the covers and makes a smart stop. They hustle across for one, though. This was shortish and cracked away
fuller and just a shade outside off, drilled down to long-off
stray ball, full toss on the leg stump, he misses the flick, off the pad to the keeper, who dives to his left and stops the ball
slower short ball outside off as Anwar rolls his fingers across it, Sibanda waits on it before pulling it towards midwicket
very, very wristy! Straight in line, he shimmies across off and picks it away over square leg for four!
slower short ball on the leg stump. Williams manufactures his own pace and pulls it to the right of deep midwicket for another boundary
slower bouncer on middle, he delays his pull and plays it in front of square on the leg side
Anwar slips in another slower bouncer, Sibanda ducks under it and lets it through to the keeoer
low full toss on middle, Williams takes toll of it as he sinks to one knee and slog-sweeps it wide of the fielder at deep midwicket
he takes it from outside off and reverse-swats it towards deep midwicket off the toe end. Umar Akmal fumbles in the deep
down the track and drilled back to the bowler, who misfields and gives away one
length on middle and leg, Sibanda clears his front leg and heaves it away towards deep midwicket
half-tracker on the leg stump, pulled to deep square leg
fired flat and just outside off, Sibanda makes some room and drives it to long-off
full and outside off, flashy drive to Lala at the covers
full on off, Sibanda backs away and hits a drive to extra cover
dug in short and rises on the stumps, pulled away to deep backward square leg
low full toss on off, he flits around in the crease and pushes it past the bowler towards long-on. Williams presses for two, the throw from Shehzad at the non-strikers' is poor
banged in shortish and around off, he goes for a pull but has to settle with a top-edge in front of long-on. They scamper for two again
full toss on the stumps, he winds up and only mishits it to long-on
slid through flat on the leg stump, pulled in front of square on the leg side
skewed in the air and lands in front of deep midwicket. Full and on middle, he swings hard and gets a top-edge in front of Mukhtar, who ran in
shorter on the leg stump, pulled away to long-on.

juggle, juggle and Anwar hangs onto it! Dropped shortish and on a leg-stump line, he goes for a pull and makes a decent connection but finds Anwar, who just about holds onto it at deep midwicket. The third attempt does it..
Williams steps away outside leg, Afridi follows him. Cracked away past the covers
fuller and on middle, Williams goes down on on knee, hits with the spin, slog-sweeping it over deep midwicket for a six. He reaches his fifty
very full and outside off, looks like the slower ball. Chigumbura drives and only meets with thin air
Sami dishes out another full toss outside off, Chigumbura latches onto it and smites it over extra cover for a six!
another another! Sami goes too full and outside off, Chigumbura ventures deep in the crease and scythes it over the covers
make that three in a row, Sami is taking a pasting! Fractionally short on off, he lustily clubs it over long-on. Sami is not getting his yorkers right
Sami aims for a yorker, has to settle with a full-toss on the pads, which is whipped to deep square leg
sliding down leg, Williams looks to force it away to leg. Does not connect, the ball wanders away fine on the leg side off the pad, the keeper has it covered
straight in line, mistimed reverse sweep in front of square on the off side
darted flat and around leg stump, he swings hard and does not connect
seam-up and short on middle, down the track and mishit to long-off
fuller and on middle, lofted in front of long-on
darted flat on off, slogged to the leg side after venturing deep in the crease. Off the inner part of the bat
back of a length, slid through quicker. Williams wants to launch it out of Lahore but can't connect
impressive overhead catch from Shehzad! Length on off from round the stumps, Chigumbura aims for a lofted drive and Shehzad takes it at long-off after moving to his left. End of a charming cameo...
Sami hunts for a yorker, but pushes it full on the pads, whipped away behind square on the leg side, beats deep fine leg who was running to his right

low full toss outside off, he steps away and cracks it to Umar Akmal at the covers. He throws it to the non-strikers', Sami takes the bails off, catching Williams short. Or has Williams managed to slide the bat in? The TV umpire examines it from various angles. The side-on angle shows that Williams is in by the time the bails were tipped off
the new man - Coventry backs away, swings and misses a shortish one that climbs over the stumps
back of a length and climbs over middle, Coventry steps away, throws his bat at it and fails to connect again
he steps away outside leg again, Sami follows him. Slogged away to the right of long-on for a couple
